comments.body:
Since type is `str` how about `enable`, `disable`, `default`? 
Because there are PRs for e.g https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/57425/files where `bfd` type is bool which accepts `true/false`, and here `str` type also accepts bool value.
I believe rather with `enable/disable`, bfd can be consistent across modules and maintainable in the long run than bool value as str.
Sounds good. I'll change it here and on the other interface-related modules that have this property.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +60,64 @@      - "Dependency: 'feature bfd'"
    version_added: "2.9"
    type: str
    choices: ['enable', 'disable', 'default']
  cost:
